yaml.title: Schedule
yaml.summary: Schedule of the TPDstat with readings, due dates, and links to materials.

markdown.markdown: ```{r packages-data, include=FALSE} library(tidyverse) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) library(lubridate) library(glue) schedule <- read_csv("data/schedule2.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) ``` Below is the schedule for the semester. You can find the materials for each course meeting under the “Content” links for that week. You should generally: - complete the readings by Tuesday; - complete the tutorials by Tuesday (if any); and - complete the problem set by Wednesday (before or after the class) (if any) - Problem set answers will be posted either Thursday or Friday (if any) Here's a guide to the schedule: - [**Materials**](/materials/) ({{< fa book-open-reader >}}): This page contains the readings, slides, and recorded lectures (if any) for the topic. Read/watch these first. - [**Tutorial**](/assignments/tutorials) ({{< fa laptop-code >}}): locally hosted tutorial. - [**Assignment**](/assignments/) ({{< fa pen-ruler >}}): This page contains the instructions for each assignment. The readings refer to following texts: - **QSS**: [*Quantitative Social Science: An Introduction in tidyverse*](https://press.princeton.edu/books/hardcover/9780691222271/quantitative-social-science) by Kosuke Imai and Nora Webb Williams - **MD**: [*Statistical Inference via Data Science: A ModernDive into R and the Tidyverse*](https://moderndive.com/index.html) by Chester Ismay and Albert Y. Kim - **IMS**: [*Introduction to Modern Statistics*](https://www.openintro.org/book/ims/) by Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel and Johanna Hardin. ```{r build-table, echo=FALSE, results="asis"} schedule <- schedule %>% mutate(var_title = ifelse(!is.na(content), glue('{title}'), glue('{title}'))) %>% mutate(var_reading = ifelse(!is.na(reading), glue('{reading}'), glue(""))) %>% mutate(var_content = ifelse(!is.na(content), glue(''), glue(''))) %>% mutate(var_tutorial = ifelse(!is.na(tutorial), glue(''), glue(''))) %>% mutate(var_assignment = ifelse(!is.na(assignment), glue(''), glue(''))) %>% mutate(col_date = ifelse(!is.na(date), glue('{format(date)}'), glue(""))) %>% mutate(col_title = var_title, col_content = var_content, col_tutorial = var_tutorial, col_reading = var_reading, col_assignment = var_assignment) %>% select(Week = week, Date = col_date, Title = col_title, Reading = col_reading, Materials = col_content, Tutorial = col_tutorial, Assignment = col_assignment) week_count <- schedule |> count(Week) week_index <- week_count |> pull(n) |> set_names(paste0("Week ", week_count$Week)) tbl <- schedule |> select(-Week) |> kbl(escap = FALSE, align = "rllccccc", table.attr = 'class="schedule-table"') |> kable_styling() |> column_spec(1, width = "20%", extra_css = "padding-right: 20px;") |> column_spec(2, width = "45%") |> column_spec(3, width = "20%") |> column_spec(c(4:6), width = "5%") |> pack_rows(index = week_index, label_row_css = "border-bottom: 2px solid #000000;") cat(tbl) ```

instructor.name: Prof. Seung-Ho An
instructor.contact_policy: We will have a group chat on "Teams." If you have any questions, you can ask in the chat or send me an email. I normally try to answer within 24 hours. If you don't hear from me in 48 hours, please feel free to send a reminder.
